review: Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed Bactrim after two other antibiotics failed to cure my UTI, and let me tell you, not only it did not work, but I also had a violent allergic reaction to it.I was suffering from my first UTI (first from many to come sadly). The symptoms went away pretty quickly after taking the first pill but came back after I stopped to take the medicine two days later. From what I remember I got really sick: chills, high fever, nausea, complete loss of appetite, extreme fatigue, and red patches all over my body but especially on my arms/ legs and chest. I had swollen lips for first indication but as I was young I didn’t understand it at first. When I went back to the doctor, he said it was a pretty powerful medicine and that he knew beforehand that a risk of allergy was higher than other medicines. I don’t hold it against him though, it was very frustrating not to find anything that would work to cure this UTI.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Worst side effects ever. I had to take this for a week and it didn't help my UTI at all. Now, I have to get another antibiotic since this one failed.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):So this for all the people with terrible anxiety like me. Don't read the reviews to freak out. If you NEED to read them to prepare yourself do it. So I got prescribed these for a UTI, 2 tablets a day/7 days. Perfect, fine. Took about 3 days to start working and now I feel generally okay, sorta burns in the morning but its whatever. Well the only side effects that is noticeable are terrible indigestion that tums don’t help, some light nausea (subsided with a probiotic) and anxiety. I generally have situational anxiety so I was shocked as to why I was having daily panic attacks and overwhelming anxiety almost all day long until I realized it was certainly Bactrim. Macrobid gave me awful migraines so this is a step in the better direction. Take it, some side effects are better than a kidney infection! Just make sure your dr does a culture & a drug resistance test on your urine so it works!

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was given Bactrim to treat a urinary tract infection. After 2 days of being on the drug I started to develop hives all over my body. Even on the soles of feet and palms of my hands. The itching is so horrible. I went to urgent care and they prescribed a steroid and hydroxyzine for the itching. Prior to this I had no allergies whatsoever not even seasonal allergies. I would ask for an antibiotic that does not contain sulfacetamide.  I also read the reviews here and wasn't worried because I never had any problems

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Prescribed this for a UTI. Took it at 6 pm & by 11 pm I was so nauseous I had to take a chewable pill for it. Finally got to sleep only to awaken after 4 am with tingling in most of my upper body, throat is dry. Noticed that the urge to go isn't there & I'm going just to go because I'm drinking plenty of water to help flush out the bacteria. I'm calling for a different medication later. Forgot to mention that I'm feeling very jittery as if I had a pot of coffee.

I am generally anxious about trying new medications, but this one had almost  no negative side effects for me. The only notable thing is it gave me a very mild stomach ache at times, but I'd expect that from an antibiotic.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):i started taking bactrim for my uti last week. It has made everything worse. I literally feel like I'm dying and I'm puking every morning. The side effects are worse so that I would much rather sit through the pain of a UTI then deal with this.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I felt mild relief in the like 3 days but after that my symptoms started coming back! I had severe panic attacks induced by strange thoughts, mild kidney twitches, just overall my body did not respond well to this medication, I was back at the urgent care after taking 2 pill/ day for 7 days

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've been taking bactrim since Friday it's now Sunday. My doctor told me it's a urinary tract infection but only symptoms I'm having is the urge to pee with little urine. Vaginal itching that comes and go with discharge. I'm ready to stop the medicine but I know I can't. I've missed two doses because the side effects are me feeling dizzy feeling nausea a bad headache and lost of appetite.  I don't know what to do I feel like if I stop taking it for a possible UTI it won't go away . But I don't feel it's a UTI cuz I'm not having burning when I pee only after I pee I have itchy feeling that I want to scratch with tissue but I know I can't do that either. I really need help and I hope someone see this that can give me honest answers .. I've been to the health unit and two hospitals they've all gave different results ..

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Had a three day course for UTI. NO reaction at all After one pill and a good night's sleep I felt a whole lot better. I don't like taking drugs and frequently have very strange side effects. NOT with this one. It only helped.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I’m on day 2 of using this medication and I cannot finish it. The first time I took it was so weak, dizzy, confused and my heart rate was through the roof. Even going up the stairs or getting up out of bed winded me and I’m completely healthy. It was so bad I’d sleep all day just hoping the symptoms would go away but I can’t take the side effects the rapid heart beat and feeling of constant anxiety. I have never felt this weak from medication. Also it has given me a pounding aura headache that just makes me extremely dizzy and exhausted I’m stopping this medication immediately and contacting my doctor this is horrible. No one should ever experience this. Uti discomfort has subsided mildly but either way I will not continue this awful medication.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This antibiotic works quickly to get rid of UTI but my main side effects are stomach pains and loss of appetite, I have one more dose to take and then I’m finish thank god. I’m taking the 800mg

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):While I understand that people who do not have many side effects from meds may think it's a mind over matter thing... some people do experience adverse effects that are seemingly unbearable. I am now myself on Bactrim.  Fatigued, depressed, irritable and having nightmares.  These side effects haven't gone away even with the best probiotics.  I still have another week to go and so I basically have to just suck it up and do the best I can.  However, to those of you who can't relate to those of us who have side effects that aren't related to the infection ... please try to be more understanding!  Thank you.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've had Bactrim three years ago for a UTI too, never had any side effects, I've tried it this week again and for the same reason because I didn't wanted to try macrobid  as I had a bad experience, but not even close to what this stuff did to me. As soon I took the drug my vagina started to itch so bad, I thought it was a yeast infection or something, then my vagina got so swollen I couldn't explain. I took only two doses and stopped, next day I was in horrible pain went to three drs to finally get a gyno to checked me he was horrified said I had a wound in my vulva, gave me some stuff that is finally giving me relief, also got my tongue so sore I can't barely eat, and the Drs doesn't care, my scalp is so sensitive I was about to call an ambulance when I got out of the shower my head felt on fire. I'm beyond traumatized after this experience and praying to God I don't have any other problems with this drug.  Could this be a Fixed drug eruption?

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed 3 days of Bactrim after reacting poorly to Cipro (after only two days) so this is sort of a combo review. I experienced dizziness, weakness and muscle cramps, especially in my hands and feet. The worst of it was a cluster headache episode that was debilitating. I just finished up the three days of Bactrim so I’m hoping these side effects wear off. UTI is cleared. Wouldn’t recommend for a mild UTI.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):The pharmacist said to take this 2x/day at the same time each day with food. Do not take on empty stomach or just a glass of water.  I should see results in two days.  I had burning when I pee, and that's a sure sign of start of UTI infection or kidney infection on it's way.   After the first pill, I felt hot, but that's easily doable and just wear cotton clothes.   He also said to keep drinking lots of water when taking this medicine or a kidney stone could develop.  So I  kept drinking lots of water.  It's been two days and I feel a lot better. My PCP prescribed a prescription for 7 days and said to finish it out and I will.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Please remember when reading reviews, people seldom come back to review if their experience was good. I would like to ease some peoples minds. Of course everyone’s body is different but Bactrim DS 800/160 is my favorite UTI medication. I have minimal side effects. I take each pill with food and a full bottle of water. I experience headaches & that’s about it. Occasionally I will feel kinda just off. But nothing crazy. I'd take the side effects vs. a UTI any day. Please at least give it a try and remember that anxiety can cause side effects itself. I also get nervous when trying a medication. However, a UTI can’t go untreated. Wishing you all the best.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Short and sweet.:I'm a person who suffers from pure OCD, panic attacks, and I'm allergic to all the cillin family. I recommend this medication. Note that everyone is different and not cookie cutter. Not every med is for every body. The only side effects I've had is slight pressure in lower throat, very slight increase in anxiety (but I'm medicated for that), and being overly tired. IDK what's up with the fatigue of it all, but it's a bad fatigue. Unnatural body weakness and feeling of lethargy. I would rate it 10/10 if it weren't for the sleepiness alone. It works though. It works so good!
Seems to interfere with my regular sleep cycle but also seems to be working as less discomfortin abdomen.  I feel I need to cut back to one tablet a day  of 160 mg and drink cranberry juice.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I have a fairly mild UTI and it has been many years since I last had one. I decided to go on antibiotics to ensure the UTI wouldn’t turn into anything more severe. I have been prescribed Bactrim for 3 days, and instructed to take 1 tablet every 12 hours (total of 6 pills). So far, no noticeable side effects. I am on day 2. I am generally medication compliant and have never experienced any serious reactions from taking medication. I think doing your part and taking care of your body by eating healthy and exercising is helpful while taking any antibiotic, including getting enough sleep. The pill itself is a medium size. Not the smallest but also not big to the point where it is difficult to swallow. I no longer have the urge to pee not do I feel any burning sensation when peeing, so the meds started working quickly! So far so good!

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Remember, you are taking this medicine to heal, to protect yourself from any worse infection. This is my second time on bactrim, I took two doses (160/80 mg)  for each day for a week. I had no side effects besides a bit of photosensitivity and a little upset stomach. Towards the end I started to get a big headache and a little pressure, but it went away. Like most people, the other reviews made me very scared, however, everyone’s experience is different, don’t let that discourage you! Unless you’re allergic to sulfa drugs, this won’t hurt you, it will help you! I hope this helps anyone who is a bit hesitant about taking this, I totally understand what you’re going through, just have the courage to push through and take care of your body!
Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I had zero side effects which I was very surprised about considering all the other comments. It cured my UTI right away and I feel great!

Took generic for UTI.  It wasn’t fun at all being on the medication but it worked!! It caused pressure and bloating/gas in my lower abdomen.  I was somewhat nauseous and developed a migraine towards the end of the treatment.  I had no idea the side effects were  gonna be so bad, but I’m kinda glad I didn’t know!!  It helped me and I’m slowly getting back to normal.  Eat meal when taking meds and drink plenty of water!

It was HORRIBLE I  had a UTI and was prescribed this med. I had every side effect listed except for vomiting.  I did not sleep for 2 nights.  I had to get up in the middle of night to shower and help itching to go away.  My stomach  still aches, dizzy, hot sweats. Dr. wanted me to go to hospital---I would not go.  On water for todayclear broth and BRAT diet slowly tomorrow.  Please be careful taking this drug!!!!

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This stuff is nightmare fuel. I’m on the third day, my UTI is still lingering and I feel worse than I’ve felt in a long time. Constant headache, weak, shaky, anxious, DIZZY, itchy??? And the diarrhea is just a fun little bonus. I would say if you’re highly sensitive to medications like I am, and you’re taking this stuff for a UTI, go and get a urine test to make sure Bactrim is the right stuff for you. Do not take this unless it’s your only option. I’m sure for those with sturdier constitutions this stuff is fine, but I’m not one of those people and I feel horrible.
Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bactrim has terrible side effects. Why would this drug even be approved with 50 percent of the patients taking it have terrible side effects.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I took Bactrim for a bad UTI. I could notice a difference in 3 hours on my symptoms. Clear in two days. No side effects at all. Took with water and sometimes food. I was scared after reading the reviews and don’t like to take new medications. I would take again if I had to. It cleared my infection quickly and I like the fact that it was a three day dose.

The reviews on this antibiotic gave me more anxiety than the actual medication. I had no serious side effects. I only experienced migraines during the first 2 days and some leg pain/body aches that I took ibuprofen for in the following days (i took it twice daily for 7 days). I took this because the previous antibiotic did not work on me and my infection came back the next day. But this antibiotic works, although it’s very strong. I felt relief in merely a few hours. A lot of other people write about fainting when they’re outside, but the medication specifically says to stay out of the sun. Others also write about vomiting when they didn’t eat anything with the meds. These side effects are often easily prevented, so don’t stress when you read about them. But seriously, be careful reading these, you’ll give yourself a panic attack like I did. Most people only write reviews when they had a terrible experience, so read mine with some comfort knowing that.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):TLDR; This drug CAN be a nightmare. I finally went to the doctor for my mild UTI. Water just wouldn't kick it. After my first dose, I was immediately thankful that I had gotten it. To my surprise, after taking the first dose, it seemed my infection had spread to my bladder. That night was awful bladder spasms and private area burning like fire. Before I took the medication, I only had slight burning with urination. The next day I pushed water like crazy and thought I was getting better. The meds made me speedy. I was in a fog, but was getting things done. I felt very sickly. I thought, again, that it was a good thing I got the antibiotics because my infection must be super severe to make me this ill. That night I got very short of breath and my heart was pounding. I thought I may have caught covid. I tried to sleep. Through the night I was awake with awful thoughts of death and severe anxiety. The next morning woke with my heart pounding and severe anxiety. I felt like death still.

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This worked quickly for my UTI caused by Klebsiella pneumoniae. I was prescribed this for 1 pill every 12 hours for 3 days. I took this along with a variety of probiotics and I didn’t have too many issues. My only problem was is that it didn’t tell me anywhere that I should probably avoid alcohol, so after day one I had two beers and woke up in the middle of the night with nausea and vomiting. After that episode, I was totally fine, just rested throughout the day. This was surprisingly mild for me and it worked really well. I am hoping it will help stop my reoccurring UTIs.

I was on Bactrim for about 6 days for a UTI.  During the last 2-3 days, I felt a knot of anxiety in my chest and generally unsettled.  It’s hard to think clearly or assess the situation when you’re under the effects of a drug that’s messing with your head, but after reading about it I thought it was Bactrim-related.  I did not take it this morning, and I made an appointment for tomorrow to re-assess the UTI. While I was at work today, I got super hot, sweaty, and dizzy. I’ve never felt like that before. I believe I ended up having a panic attack/migraine reaction. I was short of breath, had tightness in my chest, lightheaded, etc. After I went to the clinic at work and lay down for about an hour, I felt good enough to go home but still shaky and weak, which are symptoms with my chronic migraines. Bactrim is definitely going on my list of drug allergies!  It took several days for the symptoms to show up. I guess it’s because the levels of the drug had risen.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed Bactrim DS 2x a day for a UTI that wouldn’t go away after trying to treat it with cranberry. I became horrendously ill after the 2nd pill, muscle aches, muscle weakness, dizziness, rapid heart rate, feeling faint, and feeling like I couldn’t concentrate. Tried calling my dr to ask if I could go down to one pill a day as 2 felt too much, they didn’t call me back until 3 days later because of the weekend. By then I took it upon myself to only take one pill a day and my dr said that was a good decision. With one pill a day the most I felt was a slight headache and slight loss of appetite, but my UTI symptoms continued to get worse so I was put on cipro. Praying the cipro works for me now.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I completely understand how every drug effects every person differently. However, don't let reviews scare you. Understand that your doctor who prescribed this to you understands your condition, pre-existing conditions and believes the benefits far out weight the negatives. Make sure to read the details before taking it.  I have IBS, I have always dealt with stomach issues. I have been prescribed this multiple times. Every single time I have absolutely no negative side effects. Take it with food no matter what.

I have a severe fear of taking drugs..like Panic attacks and crippling anxiety. I developed a very painful UTI 3 weeks ago and tried all the at home remedies to no prevail. It continued to get worse and worse, I finally gave in and called the doc. I was terrified to take this drug but I knew that if I did not I would most likely end up with a kidney infection and way more drugs in me as a result. Let me tell you this stuff saved my butt. It cleared it right up after five days. I had zero side effects and felt normal the whole time I was taking it. I am so thankful for this drug and the healing it provided. Take your prebiotic to help build your gut biome back up, and don't forget to add in cranberry as well. Drink lots of water and follow the directions closely. I took all of my pills with a big meal and lots of water, this worked to prevent nausea and the metallic taste. So take a deep breath and let go.. it is going to be okay. Love, A person with a deep fear of medication.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):UTI came back after taking Macrobid, which was somehow more gentle to me. Started this about a week and a half later. Cleared it up again, but the only problem is I'm having is constipation and these are horse pills. YOU NEED TO EAT WITH ANTIBIOTICS!!! And drink plenty of water to flush your infection out. Not soda, not coffee, WATER. But from my experience, the harshest antibiotic was Cipro. Macrobid the gentlest, but didn't work. And I guess Bactrim is in the middle. Just my input.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):This stuff should be taken off the market! I took this for a UTI. As soon as it got in my system good, I began to feel fatigued and nauseated. Stomach cramps got worse and I just generally did not feel well. Actually I felt worse than I did with the UTI! After 4 days on it, I developed achy joints (particularly my knees), and the nausea was unbearable. My eyes felt completely dilated and I just felt like I was overdosing on this stuff. My kidney's even started hurting! And yes, I know to take antibiotics with food ( I made the mistake of not doing so once, never again!). I stopped taking it and went back to the doctor who also recommended me to stop taking Bactrim. The dosage was the generic 800/160 2X a day. I think this is WAY too strong a dosage for some people and doctors need to stop just prescribing this stuff without taking into account what each individual person's body may be able to handle.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I received a kidney transplant and have been on Bactrim the entire time. I just found out it was to help me from getting UTI’s but it didn’t work at all. This whole year I have had them every other month. I have had zero side effects with this medication and I was on about 15-20 different medications when I first received the transplant.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Started taking Bactrim for a severe UTI. I try to heal my body naturally, in this case I tried 100% cranberry juice along with D mannatose and a probiotic before seeing a dr. Sometimes medicine is just necessary. But with that being said my body is not used to meds at all. To my surprise, the side effects have been bearable. It took about 2 doses (1 full day) to feel relief. Pretty quick in my opinion. I will say I’m extremely fatigued. I’ve been taking naps daily that’s how tired I feel. I’ve also become extremely constipated. That’s probably the worst side effect I’m dealing with but I’m hoping it subsides as I just finished my last dose this morning. Otherwise, not too bad!

I was prescribed 800 mg twice a day for a UTI.  The first 2 days I experienced nausea.  But the next 3 days I had 102 fever, night sweats, sleeplessness,  nausea, muscle aches (low back, hips, jaw), and restlessness.  I was tempted to go the doctor each day, but decided to just hope it all ends once I’m finished with the antibiotic.

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Worst drug I have ever taken. Was prescribed for UTI. Like an hour after taking I got extreme chest pains and my heart rate dropped to the low 40/30s. Extreme fatigue.

I was prescribed this medicine for 5 days two pills a day. After taking the first dose in the morning my cheeks felt a little warm and looked a little pink and I had to go to the store I felt mentally out of it. Then took the next dose that evening my cheeks again slightly pink/red and went to bed. Woke up 3 hours later to pee and my legs were SO SHAKY and I felt so crazy I called my mom at 1:30 AM which I have never done. She told me to eat something and after a little while I felt better and calmed down. I was so turned up I couldn’t sleep much after. Next day I call to tell the dr she said it’s rough on the stomach to eat more while taking it. I decided against taking it the second day she was just not getting it how bad it was. Day two since I didn’t take any I thought I would be fine but I took a walk I felt a little spacey. Then went to bed that night after only two hours of sleep walk up teeth chattering and shaky legs. I couldn’t sleep the rest of the night.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I stopped taking Bactrim after 3 days because I have never experienced such joint pain in my life. I was up most of the night in excruciating pain, and when I could fall asleep I had vivid nightmares. I also started getting heaviness in my chest. Worst experience I’ve ever had on a medication also made my skin feel weird. I was prescribed this for a UTI by the 2nd day I was having a harder time going to the bathroom than before I started taking this medication. Prescription was 2x a day for 7 days
Taking it for about 3 days and getting severe anxiety, waking up at night / inability to sleep, and feelings of depression

Went in to the OBGYN office thought I had an and STD (I didn’t), they prescribed me with Metronidazole 500mg, a butt shot of cetriafixone and Doxycycline 100mg, after 2 days of taking these I developed a horrible UTI. I went in for my check up where they OBGYN prescribed me Sulfamethoxazole-TMP DS Tabs #6 for the UTI. I ate these after eating food, drinking lots of water, A WHILE AFTER TAKING THESE my heart  began to race, I mean I was in a state of tachycardia , my body was going out, my vision was blurry, I was seeing things that were NOT there, insomnia, oh and the body convulsions, I was having a full blown seizure, my husband was panicked because he had no idea what was going on. I didn’t want to go to the ER for nothing thinking maybe it was something else. It was these pills. my body was tender this morning, I could barely move, I still have 3 more days and I won’t be finishing them. Do not take these please.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):It cured my UTI! Did give some fatigue, bloating, headache, bad taste in mouth, insomnia/night anxiety???? Random, I know. I stayed up until 4 am almost every night I took it, but hey, it beats a UTI. Thank goodness I don’t deal with them often. On last day (of 5) I did get some heartburn but I also wasn’t eating much and my diet was weird so it could be unrelated. You never know what works for your body!

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed Bactrim DS 1 pill 2x a day for 10 days for a UTI. Previously a 5 day course of amoxicillin failed to rid my UTI. I don't think I started to feel better until day 7 but even though I'm now done with the course I still have slight UTI symptoms and test strips still show slight traces. I'm guessing I have a resistant strain of bacteria so I'm going to call my doctor for yet a 3rd antibiotic (I'm guessing Cipro will be next). Overall I did not have any scary symptoms. No upset stomach, no rashes or hives, no headaches. I usually ate a small snack beforehand but always drank a full glass of water with each dose (and tried to drink more through the day as well as recommended). I did my best to stay indoor and wear sunscreen too. I will say on the 7th day I did feel like the skin on my arms were a little sensitive and itchy. Like maybe the start of a rash but it's possible my seasonal allergies were kicking in (I avoided taking Claritin since I didn't know if I could).

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Let's start with the intense headache, such a bad headache, nausea, panic attacks I wouldn't recommend this to anybody this is the worst feeling I've had in a long time

This antibiotic has been the worst experience of my life. After just a day of taking it I had severe anxiety & panic attacks, no appetite & horrible headaches. I should have stopped right away. I made it three days and STOPPED. I’ve been off it now for a couple weeks things got better once I got off but there’s been some long term side effects with the anxiety (I didn’t have before) I’m working thru it one day at a time.

This is a horrible medication for me. Everyone is different though. I would not recommend.  I have had debilitating headaches and stomach upset since day one. Today (day 4) had huge anxiety attack, worst headache ever, chills, and low grade fever. Made me more anxious thinking it could be covid but temp is down. My pharmacist told me to stop taking it. It helped my uti, but the side effects are horrible!

I had acute cystitis with hematuria. I was given this medication to clear up problem. Unfortunately, I got bad reactions from the meds. I got nauseous badly to the point where I was throwing up, chest tightness, beyond fatigued and can’t eat much! FYI: I’m prediabetic, take victoZa, antidepressant (bupropion), and amphetamine for my ptsd/add. I have fatty liver disease and was told to take victoZa to help with my blood sugar levels. The meds said anyone with diabetic or liver issues shouldn’t take this medication!!!!

SMZ-TMP DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I haven’t seen this yet on the reviews but this medicine messes with my vagina. I have recurring UTI’s and I have taken Macrobid a lot and it makes it better for a week or two then they come back so this time the doctor gave me SMZ//TMP and also difulcan for yeast infection and I took both and the first day all of the muscles in my upper body were sore my throat felt extremely dry. The next day my vagina was itching really bad and it won’t stop! I’m not taking this medication again I never had any side effects from Macrobid but there has to be something else out there!!

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Several years ago I was prescribed a twice a day for seven days dose for UTI. After 3 days, I was in ICU fighting for my life due to severe reaction to Bactrim. Started as severe body aches and vomiting, by day 3 was admitted to ICU for anaphylactic shock. Recently, I was prescribed a different antibiotic(unfortunately can't recall name) for a tooth infection. After 3 days I was so very sick, I thought I was dying. I literally thought I had Covid. A voice whispered "antibiotic", I looked up ingredients and it too was a sulfa based drug. Stopped taking medication and within a day, I was much better, thank God! So, based on my experience with Bactrim and other sulfa based drugs, I would rate it 1 due to my severe allergy. But it did do a fantastic job of clearing up the UTI! I now have Bactrim and drugs like it listed as #1 allergy on medical records.
So sad I have allergy to this and I had to stop after taking 3 pills (1 and half day)

Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was really nervous to take this mediation due to reviews. I’m prescribed it twice a day for 3 days. Going on day 3 tomorrow and absolutely no side effects from the drug! Very pleased with it. Try not to look too much into it like I did. This medication is being prescribed to you for a reason!

I had epididymitis and then a UTI back in 2015. Bactrim DS worked wonders on both occasions. The only side effects I had were dizziness and urine that smelled like sulfur. I also couldn’t drink alcohol while on this medication, but it was no great loss since alcohol already irritates my bladder. Take with food.

I was dx with a UTI after getting a UA done and complaints of pain and spasms after urinating.  Prescribed Bactrim DS and completed the 7 days course. Contacted my doctor to inform him that I was still having the same symptoms, and asked to not be prescribe Bactrim DS again, since it didn't work.  Of course, he did exactly the opposite of what I asked and prescribed Bactrim DS again.  After taking the last pill, notified my doctor that I was having severe itching everywhere and had a rash on my torso.  Prescribed me a different antibiotic but nothing for the relief of the itching.
